Entities.Name: Drug
Entities.Definition: Name of the prescribed or administered medication.

Entities.Name: Strength
Entities.Definition: The potency or concentration of a medication.

Entities.Name: Form
Entities.Definition: The physical form in which a medication is administered.

Entities.Name: Frequency
Entities.Definition: How often a drug is to be taken.

Entities.Name: Route
Entities.Definition: Method by which the drug is administered.

Entities.Name: Dosage
Entities.Definition: The amount of medication taken at each administration.

Entities.Name: Duration
Entities.Definition: The period over which a drug is administered.

Entities.Name: ADE
Entities.Definition: Adverse drug event — a negative or undesired effect from medication.

Entities.Name: Reason
Entities.Definition: The condition or purpose for which a drug is administered.

Dataset.Name: n2c2 2018 ADE and Medication Dataset
Dataset.Description: 505 de-identified clinical discharge summaries annotated for drug-centric entities and relations including drug attributes, ADEs, and reasons.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Each sentence was annotated using a BIO tagging scheme for entities and a drug-centric joint encoding scheme for relations. Relations were defined only if a link existed between a drug and the relevant attribute or condition. Knowledge embeddings from FAERS were integrated to improve recognition of implicit or intersentential relationships.
